location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No 26 of 1823 from John Macleod, Resident in the Persian Gulf, Bushere [Bushire] to William Newnham, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is reporting that the expected hostilities between Muscat and Persia have been avoided by a compromise; Sa‘īd bin Sultān Āl Sa‘īd, the Imam of Muscat, has agreed to pay an annual rent to Fatḥ ‘Alī Shāh Qājār, the Shah of Persia, for the lands occupied by him on the Persian coast.
